verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى رَفَعَهُ إِلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ أَرَادَ أَكْلَ الْمَاسْتِ وَ لَا يَضُرُّهُ فَلْيَصُبَّ عَلَيْهِ الْهَاضُومَ قُلْتُ لَهُ وَ مَا الْهَاضُومُ قَالَ النَّانْخَواهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, (It has been narrated) raising it to Abu Al-Hassanasws having said: ‘The one who intends to eat the yoghurt and for it not to harm him, so let him pour the digestive (الْهَاضُومَ) over it’. I said to himasws, ‘And what is the digestive?’ Heasws said: ‘Al-Nankhwah (A herb)’.
